definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: All these writers run to sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 所有這些作家都有傷感的傾向。

sentences.english: After the joke, it's just a sad.
sentences.chinese: 玩笑過後，只是一途傷感。

sentences.english: And if you just as first, don't be sad and leave.
sentences.chinese: 若與你只如初見，又何須傷感離別。

sentences.english: Sadly, many of them are no longer around.
sentences.chinese: 傷感的是，他們之中多位已經不在了。

sentences.english: It's more important for them to trust you than to not feel hurt.
sentences.chinese: 比起傷感情來，贏得他們的信任更爲重要。

sentences.english: Cheng Fan saw e always has a kind of sad mood, flash.
sentences.chinese: 程帆看出了麗君總有那麼一絲，一閃的傷感情緒。

sentences.english: “Nothing much for us to do, ” the intern said grimly.
sentences.chinese: “我們根本無能爲力了，”實習生傷感地說道。

sentences.english: My wife's an old softy who cries at sad movies.
sentences.chinese: 我妻子是個看傷感電影就哭的極易動感情的人。

sentences.english: NEXT time a sentimental movie makes you cry, blame your serotonin levels.
sentences.chinese: 下次傷感電影讓你哭的時候，去怪你的血清素水平吧。

sentences.english: She criticized what she described as the film's cloying sentimentality .
sentences.chinese: 她批評這部影片如她所說的令人倒胃口的傷感情調。

sentences.english: Is the most sentimental time, his coffin.
sentences.chinese: 最最傷感是流年，白髮罩住了紅顏。

sentences.english: I can hear all of the maudlin talk already.
sentences.chinese: 我現在已經能感受到所有傷感的話語。

sentences.english: Disturbed the night to sing to sing the dim light the lower levels become out of my mind sad recollections.
sentences.chinese: 夜唱忐忑唱燈火闌珊下情已成追憶傷感出我的心聲。

sentences.english: It was full of tender feeling and sentiment, loneliness and warmth.
sentences.chinese: 溫情又傷感，孤寂又溫馨。

sentences.english: King division north recall past with brother stiffening of the situation, the very sad.
sentences.chinese: 王師北迴想起昔日與兄弟並肩殺敵的情形，萬分傷感。

sentences.english: She admitted to being a little sad about not being in Beijng for the Olympics this summer.
sentences.chinese: 她承認她因爲不能參加北京奧運會有一點傷感。

definition: to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
to cherish the memory of/to think of/reminisce
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
